latestAction.text: Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary.

item.title: Furthering Asbestos Claim Transparency (FACT) Act of 2013

latestAction.text: Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary.

item.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 223 - 194 (Roll no. 574). (text: CR H7009-7010)
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Passed/agreed to in House: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 223 - 194 (Roll no. 574).(text: CR H7009-7010)
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 224 - 195 (Roll no. 573). (consideration: CR H7017)
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 403.
Considered as privileged matter. (consideration: CR H7009-7017)
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 72.

The resolution provides for the consideration of H.R. 2655 and H.R. 982. In the case of H.R. 2655, the resolution provides for one hour of debate and one motion to recommit. In the case of H.R. 982, the resolution provides for one hour of general debate and makes in order only those amendments printed in the Rules Committee report. The resolution also provides for one motion to recommit the bill H.R. 982.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 113-264, by Mr. Woodall.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 113-264, by Mr. Woodall.

summary.text: Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 2655) to amend Rule 11 of the Federal Rules of Civil Procedure to improve attorney accountability, and for other purposes, and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 982) to amend title 11 of the United States Code to require the public disclosure by trusts established under section 524(g) of such title, of quarterly reports that contain detailed information regarding the receipt and disposition of claims for injuries based on exposure to asbestos.

bill.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 2655) to amend Rule 11 of the Federal Rules of Civil Procedure to improve attorney accountability, and for other purposes, and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 982) to amend title 11 of the United States Code to require the public disclosure by trusts established under section 524(g) of such title, of quarterly reports that contain detailed information regarding the receipt and disposition of claims for injuries based on exposure to asbestos; and for other purposes.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
